section.name: Deployment guide
section.p: This Guide is work in progress.
The prepackaged WARs comes with following general configurations (for details see Proximity Default Configuration):

ul.li: The root of proximity storages are in user home directory.

section.p: Since Proximity uses SLF4J project for logging, see SLF4J Site for additional logging configuration possibilities.
Now, we will see some web container specific tasks for Proximity deployment.

subsection.name: Apache Tomcat
subsection.p: Proximity has been extensively tested on Tomcat 5.5.x line. For deployment on Tomcat, you simply need to "drop" the WAR file in $CATALINA_HOME/webapps directory. Proximity may have problems with logging, see SLF4J documentation about it. You may need some additional steps:

ul.li: If you can, remove log4j.jar from Tomcat installation, or swap logger implementation during deployment, as described on SLF4J site.

subsection.p: Advanced users may unpack the WAR and gain access to configuration files. Also, please review the logging settings (nLog4j currently), since it may not be suited your needs!

subsection.name: Jetty
subsection.p: Proximity has been extensively tested on Jetty 5.1.11 line. For deployment on Jetty, you need some additional steps:

ul.li: Remove XercesImpl-2.6.2.jar from WAR, since it conflicts with Jetty's one.

subsection.p: Finally, simply "drop" the WAR file in $JETTY_HOME/webapps directory.
Advanced users may unpack the WAR and gain access to configuration files. Also, please review the logging settings (Log4j currently), since it may not be suited your needs!
NOTE: On unreleased Jetty6 no steps are reqiured to deploy Proximity.
